text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen I want to show you
what I call my Mexican Chocolate Snickerdoodles.

Basically chocolate snicker doodles that are
just kissed slightly by a little bit of heat

in the form of cayenne pepper, but as we all
know a classic sort of Mexican chocolate combination

is a little bit of something spicy with some
sort of chili powder, chocolate and cinnamon,

so that's why I'm calling these that, these
are so good, a great way to kick off sort

of like the holiday baking season in terms
of cookies with this recipe because these

are just phenomenal and so easy, I'm just
going to make them in a bowl with a whisk
and a spatula and they're amazing.
I've got my oven pre-heated to 350F.

I've got some butter here, softened butter,
I just sort of soften it a little bit more

with my spatula and then to it I'm going to
add some granulated sugar.

Now, I'm only making half of a full batch
because it makes a lot of cookies and to be

quite frank, if they are here then they will
get eaten - all of them.

So this is going to be perfect because we
will have enough on hand to indulge throughout

the week, but not so many that we overindulge
throughout the week!
If that makes any sense.

Just mix together the two, just like so, and
then I'm going to add and egg and a good splash

of vanilla, if you're using homemade vanilla,
make sure you give it a nice shake because
the seeds settle to the bottom of the jar.
Give that a stir around, mix mix mix.

Lovely, and then for dry ingredients, what
I have got is all purpose flour, baking soda,
salt, cocoa powder, and some cayenne pepper.

Now when I say cayenne pepper, please don't
be turned off by thinking that this is going

to be really spicy and just like weird, it's
not.

Basically the cayenne pepper is a little tickle
and it almost awakens the chocolate and that's
what makes these so good.
It makes the chocolate really intense.
Phenomenal.

So what I'm going to do now, I just switched
to my spatula.

And I'm going to mix these together, you can
see what I do here I kinda like press it in

- the butter and the egg, until they're all
combined.

Just mix until the flour is all combined is
what I meant.
Perfect.

So, let me show you what I've got here, I've
got some cinnamon sugar, I've just got some

sugar and a little bit of cinnamon mixed together
and I've got a baking sheet with some parchment

paper ready, and I also have my handy dandy
ice cream scoop, and what you do is you just

take your dough, you drop it in there, and
you roll that around in the cinnamon sugar
like so.

And you place them on your baking sheet and
you just make sure you leave some space in

between and I'm just going to go ahead and
continue on.

Alright these are rolled out and ready to
go, I'm going to save a little bit more of

the dough for probably tomorrow or a little
bit later on to make fresh ones.

I'm going to pop these into my 350F degree
oven for a bout 15 minutes and I'll show you
what they look like when they're done.

My cookies were in the oven for 15 minutes
exactly, I took them out I let them cool completely

on a wire rack and I am just like, if you
could just smell in here' you'd be so excited,

I mean look at the interior, look how gorgeous,
it's nice and chewy on the inside, and it's

really nice and crispy on the outside from
the sugar coating.
Mmm!

It's everything a good cookie should be and
more.

Like I said, really crunchy outside, really
chewy inside, perfect on every level, like
nothing else needs to be said.
Super good, super easy, super yummy.

Perfect for this time of year, just that little
bit of kick in the back of your throat, makes

this thing really shine because it makes that
chocolate really vibrant and rich.

LauraintheKitchen.com has got you set up for
the recipe, I hope you've enjoyed spending
time with me and I'll see you next time.
Bye.
